page.title: 13Facilities in Lullington
page.content: Due to its remoteness Lullington offers very few facilities. There is a post office, public house, a village hall & All Saints Church. The village hall was once a school but due to a fall in numbers junior school children now travel to Coton-in -the-Elms 2.3 km away. Milk deliveries are made every other day & the absence of a bus service means a car is essential. Weekly shopping is done at Burton or Swadlincote although the post office does sell basic provisions. Recreation facilities are more suited to older residents & include a cricket club, bowling green (behind the Colvile Arms) & the White Heather Club held in the village hall.For the younger generation entertainment & other sports facilities are found only by travelling to nearby towns.
